alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued February 12 at 10:43PM PST until February 15 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM MONDAY TO 10 PM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 14 to 18 feet and local sets to 20 feet with dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...San Luis Obispo County Beaches and Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches. * WHEN...From 4 PM Monday to 10 PM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There is additionally the possibility that breaking waves could affect the entrance of the Morro Bay Harbor.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Stay off rock jetties, since they can be deadly locations in such conditions.

area.areaDesc: San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches
